de.dimensionv.java.libraries.common.utilities.strings

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dimensionv.java.libraries.common.utilities.strings.StringUtils

  • public class StringUtils
extends Object
    This is a utility class for common string-related operations. Many of these methods are thus available statically.
    Since:
    API 1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Volkmar Seifert <vs@DimensionV.de>

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(String text)
        Universal check on String-objects that even works on non-instantiated variables (null-references), as it checks for null first. If a string-reference is null, it is considered to be empty, the same goes for string-objects that only contain blank characters like tabs, spaces, carriage returns and line-feeds - and any other character that falls under the \s regular expression class.
        Parameters:
        text - The string-object to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the given string-object is empty according to the rules described above.

      • bytesToHex

        public static String bytesToHex(byte[] bytes)
        Convert an array of arbitrary bytes into a String of hexadecimal number-pairs with each pair representing on byte of the array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array to convert into hexadecimal string
        Returns:
        the String containing the hexadecimal representation of the array

      • hexToBytes

        public static byte[] hexToBytes(String hex)
        Convert a string consisting of hex-numbers into an array of bytes, which contains the binary representation of those hexadecimal-numbers (takes pairs of numbers, so make sure the number of characters is even).
        Parameters:
        hex - String of pairs of hexadecimal numbers
        Returns:
        byte-array with the binary representation of the hex-string

      • sha1Hash

        public static String sha1Hash(String text)
                       throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              UnsupportedEncodingException
        Compute the SHA-1 hash of a string, and return it has a string of hexadecimal numbers. The incoming text is assumed to be UTF-8 encoded. An exception will be thrown if this encoding is not supported.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to compute the SHA-1 hash of
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal representation of the hash
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the SHA-1 algorithm cannot be found
        UnsupportedEncodingException - thrown if the encoding is not supported

      • sha1HashInt

        public static int sha1HashInt(String text)
                       throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              UnsupportedEncodingException
        Compute the SHA-1 hash of a string, and return a truncated int-value of the hash. The incoming text is assumed to be UTF-8 encoded. An exception will be thrown if this encoding is not supported.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to compute the SHA-1 hash of
        Returns:
        a truncated int-value of the hash.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the SHA-1 algorithm cannot be found
        UnsupportedEncodingException - thrown if the encoding is not supported

      • sha1HashLong

        public static long sha1HashLong(String text)
                         throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                UnsupportedEncodingException
        Compute the SHA-1 hash of a string, and return a truncated long-value of the hash. The incoming text is assumed to be UTF-8 encoded. An exception will be thrown if this encoding is not supported.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to compute the SHA-1 hash of
        Returns:
        a truncated long-value of the hash.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the SHA-1 algorithm cannot be found
        UnsupportedEncodingException - thrown if the encoding is not supported

        public static String md5Hash(String text)
                      throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                             UnsupportedEncodingException
        Compute the MD-5 hash of a string, and return it has a string of hexadecimal numbers. The incoming text is assumed to be UTF-8 encoded. An exception will be thrown if this encoding is not supported.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the hexadecimal representation of the hash
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the MD-5 algorithm cannot be found
        UnsupportedEncodingException - thrown if the encoding is not supported

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

        public static int truncateHashToInt(String hash)
        Computes a truncated code from the given hash-value and returns it as int-variable.
        Parameters:
        hash - the hash-string
        Returns:
        truncated code as int

      • shorten

        public static String shorten(String text,
             int size,
             int mode)
        Shortens a given String "text" down to size length, indicating the shortening by three dots ("..."). Mode determines the position of the dots and where the text will be cut off.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to shorten
        size - The size the text is to shortened to.
        mode - The mode in which the string shall be shortened
        Returns:
        The shortened string.
